javadoc:
Panel that shows the users for a given repository and the users associated with the current shared project. There are 3 main sub-panels:

  • Known Users Panel: Displays all users in the repository
  • Button Panel: Provides buttons for adding/removing users from the project
  • User Access Panel: Displays all users on the project, and their access permissions

    • If the current user is an admin, he may change user permissions and add/remove them from the project. If not, only the User Access Panel will be visible and it will be read-only.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Construct a new panel from a RepositoryAdapter instance.

throws.comment: if there's an error processing the repository user list

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment: Constructs a new panel from the given arguments.

params.name: knownUsers
params.comment: names of the users that are known to the remote server

params.name: allUsers
params.comment: all users known to the repository

params.name: anonymousServerAccessAllowed
params.comment: true if the server allows anonymous access

params.name: anonymousAccessEnabled
params.comment:
true if the repository allows anonymous access 
 (ignored if anonymousServerAccessAllowed is false)

Sets the help location.
@param helpLoc the help location
methods.name: setHelpLocation

methods.javadoc:
Returns a list of all users with permission to access the project.
@return the list of users
methods.name: getProjectUsers
methods.comment: Returns a list of all users with permission to access the project.

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if anonymous access is allowed by the repository.
@return true if allowed
methods.name: allowAnonymousAccess
methods.comment: Returns true if anonymous access is allowed by the repository.

methods.javadoc:
Returns the repository name.
@return the repository name
methods.name: getRepositoryName

methods.javadoc:
Creates the main gui panel, containing the known users, button, and user access 
 panels.
methods.name: createMainPanel
methods.comment:
Creates the main gui panel, containing the known users, button, and user access 
 panels.

name: ProjectAccessPanel
comment:
Panel that shows the users for a given repository and the users associated with the current
 shared project. There are 3 main sub-panels:
 
 Known Users Panel: Displays all users in the repository
 Button Panel: Provides buttons for adding/removing users from the project
 User Access Panel: Displays all users on the project, and their access permissions
 
 If the current user is an admin, he may change user permissions and add/remove them 
 from the project. If not, only the User Access Panel will be visible and it will
 be read-only.
